text: The General Assembly of Budapest (; “Capital City Assembly”) is a unicameral body consisting of 33 members, which consist of the 23 mayors of the districts, 9 from the electoral lists of political parties, and the Mayor of Budapest (who is elected directly). Each term for the mayor and assembly members lasts five years. ==2019 Election Results== Budapest City Hall building near Deák Ferenc tér in Városház street, the office of Budapest's Mayor The eclectic building of New Budapest City Hall in Váci Street, the seat of the General Assembly ===Mayor=== Result of the mayoral election: ===General Assembly of Budapest=== {| class="wikitable" !Party !Mayor of Budapest !Mayors of the districts !Compensation-list !Altogether |- |Fidesz–KDNP |align="center" | ||align="center" |7 ||align="center" |6 ||align="center" |13 |- |MSZP | ||align="center" |6 ||align="center" |1 ||align="center" | 7 |- |DK | ||align="center" |3 ||align="center" |1 ||align="center" | 4 |- |Momentum | ||align="center" |3 ||align="center" |1 ||align="center" | 4 |- | PM |align="center" | 1 ||align="center" |1 || ||align="center" | 2 |- | Independents | ||align="center" |3 || ||align="center" | 3 |- |Altogether |align="center" |1 ||align="center" |23 ||align="center" |9 ||align="center" | 33 |} ==See also== * National Assembly (Hungary) * Budapest ==References== Category:Organizations with year of establishment missing Category:Organisations based in Budapest Category:Local government in Hungary Budapest
title: General Assembly of Budapest
